member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Diagnostics.AnalyzerFileReference
member.summary: Represents analyzers stored in an analyzer assembly file.
member.remarks:
Analyzer are read from the file, owned by the reference, and doesn't change since the reference is accessed until the reference object is garbage collected.
If you need to manage the lifetime of the anayzer reference (and the file stream) explicitly use .

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CommandLineParser.RemoveAllQuotes(System.String)
member.summary: Remove all double quote characters from the given string.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CommandLineParser.SplitCommandLineIntoArguments(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Split a command line by the same rules as Main would get the commands.
member.remarks:
Rules for command line parsing, according to MSDN:
Arguments are delimited by white space, which is either a space or a tab.
A string surrounded by double quotation marks ("string") is interpreted as a single argument, regardless of white space contained within. A quoted string can be embedded in an argument.
A double quotation mark preceded by a backslash (\") is interpreted as a literal double quotation mark character (").
Backslashes are interpreted literally, unless they immediately precede a double quotation mark.
If an even number of backslashes is followed by a double quotation mark, one backslash is placed in the argv array for every pair of backslashes, and the double quotation mark is interpreted as a string delimiter.
If an odd number of backslashes is followed by a double quotation mark, one backslash is placed in the argv array for every pair of backslashes, and the double quotation mark is "escaped" by the remaining backslash, causing a literal double quotation mark (") to be placed in argv.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CommandLineParser.Split(System.String,System.Func{System.Char,System.Boolean})
member.summary: Split a string, based on whether "splitHere" returned true on each character.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CommandLineParser.CondenseDoubledBackslashes(System.String)
member.summary: Condense double backslashes that precede a quotation mark to single backslashes.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CommandLineParser.AddBackslashes(System.Text.StringBuilder,System.Int32)
member.summary: Add "count" backslashes to a StringBuilder.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CommandLineParser.ParseSeparatedStrings(System.String,System.Char[],System.StringSplitOptions)
member.summary: Split a string by a set of separators, taking quotes into account.

member.summary: Tries to parse a UInt64 from string in either decimal, octal or hex format.
member.param: The string value.
The result if parsing was successful.
member.returns: true if parsing was successful, otherwise false.

member.summary: Tries to parse a UInt16 from string in either decimal, octal or hex format.
member.param: The string value.
The result if parsing was successful.
member.returns: true if parsing was successful, otherwise false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.FileSystemExtensions.Emit(Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Compilation,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ResourceDescription},System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Emit the IL for the compilation into the specified stream.
member.param: Compilation.
Path of the file to which the compilation will be written.
Path of the file to which the compilation's debug info will be written. Also embedded in the output file. Null to forego PDB generation.
Path of the file to which the compilation's XML documentation will be written. Null to forego XML generation.
Path of the file from which the compilation's Win32 resources will be read (in RES format). Null to indicate that there are none.
List of the compilation's managed resources. Null to indicate that there are none.
To cancel the emit process.
member.exception: An error occurred while reading or writing a file.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.DesktopAssemblyIdentityComparer.#ctor(Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.AssemblyPortabilityPolicy)
member.param: Assembly portability policy, usually provided through an app.config file.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.DesktopAssemblyIdentityComparer.LoadFromXml(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Loads information from XML with App.config schema.
member.exception: The stream doesn't contain a well formed XML.
member.remarks:
Tries to find supportPortability elements in the given XML:
<configuration> <runtime> <assemblyBinding xmlns="urn:schemas-microsoft-com:asm.v1"> <supportPortability PKT="7cec85d7bea7798e" enable="false"/> <supportPortability PKT="31bf3856ad364e35" enable="false"/> </assemblyBinding> </runtime> </configuration>
Keeps the stream open.

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Text.EncodedStringText.s_fallbackEncoding
member.summary: Encoding to use when there is no byte order mark (BOM) on the stream. This encoder may throw a if the stream contains invalid UTF-8 bytes.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Text.EncodedStringText.Create(System.IO.Stream,System.Text.Encoding,Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Text.SourceHashAlgorithm)
member.summary: Initializes an instance of from the provided stream. This version differs from in two ways: 1. It attempts to minimize allocations by trying to read the stream into a byte array. 2. If is null, it will first try UTF8 and, if that fails, it will try extended ASCII (code page 1252).
member.param: The stream containing encoded text.

Specifies an encoding to be used if the actual encoding can't be determined from the stream content (the stream doesn't start with Byte Order Mark). If not specified auto-detect heuristics are used to determine the encoding. If these heuristics fail the decoding is assumed to be . Note that if the stream starts with Byte Order Mark the value of is ignored.
Hash algorithm used to calculate document checksum.
member.exception: The stream content can't be decoded using the specified , or is null and the stream appears to be a binary file.
An IO error occurred while reading from the stream.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Text.EncodedStringText.Decode(System.IO.Stream,System.Text.Encoding,Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Text.SourceHashAlgorithm,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Try to create a from the given stream using the given encoding.
member.param: The input stream containing the encoded text. The stream will not be closed.
The expected encoding of the stream. The actual encoding used may be different if byte order marks are detected.
The checksum algorithm to use.
Throw if binary (non-text) data is detected.
member.returns: The decoded from the stream.
member.exception: The decoder was unable to decode the stream with the given encoding.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Text.EncodedStringText.TryGetByteArrayFromStream(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Some streams are easily represented as byte arrays.
member.param: The stream
member.returns: The contents of as a byte array or null if the stream can't easily be read into a byte array.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Text.EncodedStringText.TryGetByteArrayFromMemoryStream(System.IO.MemoryStream,System.Byte[]@)
member.summary: If the MemoryStream was created with publiclyVisible=true, then we can access its buffer directly and save allocations in StreamReader. The input MemoryStream is not closed on exit.
member.returns: True if a byte array could be created.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Text.EncodedStringText.TryGetByteArrayFromFileStream(System.IO.FileStream,System.Byte[]@)
member.summary: Read the contents of a into a byte array.
member.param: The FileStream with encoded text.
A byte array filled with the contents of the file.
member.returns: True if a byte array could be created.

member.summary: Search paths used when resolving metadata references.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.MetadataFileReferenceResolver.BaseDirectory
member.summary: Directory used for resolution of relative paths. A full directory path or null if not available.
member.remarks:
This directory is only used if the base directory isn't implied by the context within which the path is being resolved.
It is used, for example, when resolving a strong name key file specified in , or a metadata file path specified in .
Resolution of a relative path that needs the base directory fails if the base directory is null.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.MetadataFileReferenceResolver.ResolveReference(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Resolves a metadata reference that is a path or an assembly name.
member.param: Reference path.
The base file path to use to resolve relative paths against. Null to use the as a base for relative paths.
member.returns: Normalized absolute path to the referenced file or null if it can't be resolved.

member.name: M:Roslyn.Utilities.FileUtilities.ResolveRelativePath(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.Func{System.String,System.Boolean})
member.summary: Resolves relative path and returns absolute path. The method depends only on values of its parameters and their implementation (for fileExists). It doesn't itself depend on the state of the current process (namely on the current drive directories) or the state of file system.
member.param: Path to resolve.
Base file path to resolve CWD-relative paths against. Null if not available.
Base directory to resolve CWD-relative paths against if isn't specified. Must be absolute path. Null if not available.
Sequence of paths used to search for unqualified relative paths.
Method that tests existence of a file.
member.returns: The resolved path or null if the path can't be resolved.

member.name: M:Roslyn.Utilities.FileUtilities.DeleteFileOnClose(System.String)
member.summary: Marks given file for automatic deletion when all its handles are closed. Note that after doing this the file can't be opened again, not even by the same process.

member.name: M:Roslyn.Utilities.PathUtilities.GetDirectoryName(System.String)
member.summary: Get directory name from path.
member.remarks: Unlike it doesn't check for invalid path characters, doesn't strip any trailing directory separators (TODO: tomat), doesn't recognize UNC structure \\computer-name\share\directory-name\file-name (TODO: tomat).
member.returns: Prefix of path that represents a directory.

member.name: M:Roslyn.Utilities.PathUtilities.IsDriveRootedAbsolutePath(System.String)
member.summary: Returns true if given path is absolute and starts with a drive specification ("C:\").

member.name: M:Roslyn.Utilities.PathUtilities.GetPathRoot(System.String)
member.summary: Get a prefix of given path which is the root of the path.
member.returns: Root of an absolute path or null if the path isn't absolute or has invalid format (e.g. "\\"). It may or may not end with a directory separator (e.g. "C:\", "C:\foo", "\\machine\share", etc.) .

member.name: M:Roslyn.Utilities.PathUtilities.GetUncPathRootLength(System.String)
member.summary: Calculates the length of root of an UNC path.

member.name: M:Roslyn.Utilities.PathUtilities.CombineAbsoluteAndRelativePaths(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Combines an absolute path with a relative.
member.param: Absolute root path.
Relative path.
member.returns: An absolute combined path, or null if is absolute (e.g. "C:\abc", "\\machine\share\abc"), relative to the current root (e.g. "\abc"), or relative to a drive directory (e.g. "C:abc\def").

member.name: M:Roslyn.Utilities.PathUtilities.CombinePossiblyRelativeAndRelativePaths(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Combine two paths, the first of which may be absolute.
member.param: First path: absolute, relative, or null.
Second path: relative and non-null.
member.returns: null, if is null; a combined path, otherwise.
